name: Santa Barbara Beach & Golf Resort, Curacao

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful romantic vacation at the Hyatt. The staff were helpful and friendly. The resort is fairly new and the rooms are clean and comfortable, A car is needed as the hotel is located a distance from everywhere else. Once on the property it is a 10 minute drive to the hotel. The Shor restaurant was delicious. We did not like the Medi for dinner. The breakfast buffet is worth it. They will even give you a to go bag. Every morning we packed a picnic lunch free for the day and the staff was eager to help us. There is a pizza place that serves sandwiches and pizza.It was yummy and a nice break from eating expensive. I would highly recommend the Hyatt in Curacao.
reviews.title: Can't wait to return

reviews.text: Curacao is a fairly poor island with mostly mid-range hotels and in our opinion this is by far the best hotel on the island and frankly, we even liked it better than two other top-end hotels in Aruba on Eagle Beach because this hotel is quiet, spacious and not over-crowded and there are no other hotels nearby and no vendors on the beaches. We were able to get a second room for our kids at half-price by calling Hyatt to reserve, which significantly enhanced our relaxation quotient. This is a perfectly executed 4-star resort - the layout feels like a 5 star but they make appropriate cut-backs that you don't really notice to keep prices down. We spent 4 days here and that was enough - by check-out we had eaten everywhere, played everywhere and generally absorbed the full vibe - if we had stayed longer I think we would have gotten bored because the hotel is very far from everything (45 minutes from the airport and 20 minutes to town so unless you rent a car you are kind of trapped).
reviews.title: A perfect 4 star calibre beach vacation

reviews.text: The beach was lovely - nice soft sand, big, not crowded, plenty of chairs and shade under beautiful trees, our kids spent hours seated in the shallow, calm water building sand castles. The pools were fine - not too crowded and clean and different types of chairs are available to suit different tastes.
reviews.title: Not what they advertised

reviews.text: The food was fairly priced and decent (taking into consideration that you're on an island and everything has to be imported). Nothing novel or gourmet, but good. Rooms and bathrooms were clean, new, nice and spacious. We had a "premier water view" on the 4th floor which is probably ideal - you have a nice view of the beach and waterway - I think these views are actually better than views of the ocean and the rocky landscape below. We didn't really use our balcony much, but they all have 2 chairs, a table and a ceiling fan. The hotel is long and skinny so you will walk alot from one place to another and asking for a room close to the lobby will only guarantee you noise.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I were returning to Curacao I would definitely come back here. I rarely give 5 stars to a hotel on Tripadvisor, but this hotel was a fantastic value and we had an almost flawless vacation. Our only complaints, and they are minor, were that maid service arrived very late (every day right at 3:15 when our kids go down for naps) and the mattresses on the beds are saggy and not supportive.
reviews.title: Great resort for a relaxing get-away!

reviews.text: Amazing spot to relax and unwind. lovely/clean rooms, and staff knows your name! I only left the hotel once to go to the downtown area - it's about a half hour ride, but you can have the hotel tourism office arrange for you for $16USD total.
reviews.title: perfect getaway!

Just returned from a week at this resort. We had been there when they had first opened and loved it and wanted to share it with my siste, her husband and twein 10 year olds. It did not disappoint. The rooms were beautiful and clean, service was excellent, people friendly and the beach and pool as beautiful as we remembered. A day trip run by Ocean Encounters to Klein Curacao was (again) a highlight. The color of the water was breathtaking. The fish and, especially the sea turtles were a beautiful sight. Pack lots of sunscreen. It was hot but pleasant breezes.

reviews.text: We have previously stayed at Blue Bay and our experience there (and in fact with many of the restaurants and sights of Curacao) practically made us write off the island as a place to return to, but on our last day we stopped by the Hyatt and realized this was something different entirely.
reviews.title: The friendliest staff and most amazing service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is absolutely beautiful, with stunning views of the Caribean sea, beautiful rooms, a pool we could (and did!) spend days at and a golf course that is certainly challenging but also rewarding enough to keep you coming back for more.
reviews.title: Destination Wedding Perfection

aka: Hyatt Regency Curacao Golf Resort, Spa And Marina Hotel
description: Santa Barbara Beach & Golf Resort captures natural Caribbean charm and delivers it with an international elegance and sophistication. Just 35 miles from Aruba and served by a modern international airport, escape to paradise and embrace Curacao’s magical sea, sky and sun on 27 acres of rare natural preserve. At the same time, feel that every need is provided for, with exceptional service and refinement. Enjoy superior amenities like the Pete Dye designed golf course, a luxurious spa, resort pools with Caribbean views, an alluring white sand beach with a swimming lagoon, and sophisticated dining. Relax with the rare luxury of privacy on a secluded island within an island sequestered from the hustle and bustle of town center, and explore unlimited diving, snorkeling, boating and geo adventure right outside your door. Whether you are seeking an intimate retreat, or a lively and invigorating amenity-filled vacation, the resort creates a truly magnificent opportunity to experience the best of both worlds, and create your own.
